gate.plugin.learningframework

Class AbstractDocumentProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • gate.util.AbstractFeatureBearer
      • gate.creole.AbstractResource
        • gate.creole.AbstractProcessingResource
          • gate.creole.AbstractLanguageAnalyser
            • gate.plugin.learningframework.AbstractDocumentProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    gate.creole.ANNIEConstants, gate.creole.ControllerAwarePR, gate.Executable, gate.LanguageAnalyser, gate.ProcessingResource, gate.Resource, gate.util.Benchmarkable, gate.util.FeatureBearer, gate.util.NameBearer, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LearningFrameworkPRBase, LF_ExportText, LF_GenFeatures_Affixes, LF_GenFeatures_Misc

    public abstract class AbstractDocumentProcessor
extends gate.creole.AbstractLanguageAnalyser
implements gate.creole.ControllerAwarePR, gate.util.Benchmarkable
    Abstract base class for all the PRs in this plugin.

      • controllerExecutionAborted

        public void controllerExecutionAborted(gate.Controller arg0,
                                       Throwable arg1)
                                throws gate.creole.ExecutionException
        Handle the controller execution aborted callback. This does very much the same as the controller execution finished callback but also stores the last Throwable so it can be inspected by the PR.
        Specified by:
        controllerExecutionAborted in interface gate.creole.ControllerAwarePR
        Parameters:
        arg0 - controller invoking the callback
        arg1 - throwable representing the error that was encountered
        Throws:
        gate.creole.ExecutionException - can be thrown

      • process

      • controllerStarted

        public abstract void controllerStarted(gate.Controller ctrl)
        Callback for when each controller gets started on a corpus. This method gets called once when processing starts for a controller. This replaces the controllerExecutionStarted callback which must not be overridden! Note that controllerStarted gets invoked for each duplicate in sequence, without any concurrency and that (in the case of GCP at least) the order of invocation should agree with the order of creation, so it should match the duplicateId assigned to each instance.
        Parameters:
        ctrl - the controller instance

      • controllerFinished

        public abstract void controllerFinished(gate.Controller ctrl,
                                        Throwable thrw)
        Callback for when each controller finishes on a corpus. This method gets called once when processing finishes for a controller. This replaces the controllerExecutionFinished and controllerExecutionAborted callbacks which must not be overridden! If the execution of a controller had an error, the Throwable is non-null, otherwise a null Throwable indicates normal completion. Note that controllerFinished gets invoked for each duplicate in sequence, without any concurrency and that (in the case of GCP at least) the order of invocation should agree with the order of creation, so it should match the duplicateId assigned to each instance.
        Parameters:
        ctrl - the controller instance
        thrw - the Throwable indicating the error or null for normal completion
